Narrative: Today started off with the usual hustle and bustle of Manila, but the heavy pollution in the air made it harder to breathe. As I walked to class, the smog hung low, obscuring the sky and leaving a grey film on everything. It was a constant reminder of the environmental challenges we face in this bustling city. Despite the pollution, I pushed through, determined to make the most out of my day at DLSU.

Today was just another typical day as an undergraduate student at DLSU. As I made my way to campus, the bustling streets were filled with the usual chaos and pollution. The air was thick with exhaust fumes, making it hard to breathe. I couldn't help but feel frustrated by the constant presence of pollution, knowing the negative impact it has on our health and environment. Despite this daily hassle, I remained determined to carry on with my studies and contribute to finding sustainable solutions for a cleaner and healthier future.

Despite the daily hassles, I couldn't help but feel determined to make a difference and raise awareness about the importance of taking care of our planet.

Despite the challenges, I remained determined to make a difference and find ways to combat this environmental issue.

So, it was just another typical day at DLSU. I was walking towards the library to finish my research paper when I suddenly heard a commotion nearby. I turned my head to find a group of people surrounding a student whose bag had been snatched by a thief. It was disheartening to witness such a crime on campus. Thankfully, campus security arrived swiftly and managed to apprehend the thief. It was a reminder that even in the midst of our daily routines, crime can still find its way to disrupt our peace.

Today started off like any other day at DLSU, but it quickly took an unexpected turn. As I made my way to class, I witnessed a crime right in front of me. The commotion drew the attention of onlookers, and before long, campus security arrived to diffuse the situation. Though shaken by the incident, I am grateful for their prompt response. It serves as a reminder that even within the confines of our university, crime can still rear its ugly head. Stay alert and stay safe, fellow Lasallians.

So, I woke up this morning and felt the weight of being a broke college student. As if the pile of assignments wasn't enough, I had to face the rising prices of common goods too. I walked into the cafeteria hoping to grab a quick, cheap breakfast, only to find out that the prices had skyrocketed overnight. With a heavy sigh, I reluctantly paid for my meal, contemplating how to stretch my budget for the rest of the day. The struggle is real, but hey, at least my determination to survive college is stronger than the rising prices!
